result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Stepheny Markasia Hunter

records.addlTxt: Received and Filed. DPA Court Report 11.04.22

Defendant Stepheny Markasia Hunter appeared by video.  Attorney Fred Richardson III in court for Stepheny Markasia Hunter.  Attorney Amy E Spanczak in court for State of Wisconsin.  Parties are prepared to enter into a deferred prosecution agreement.

AS TO COUNT 1.  Defendant was advised of constitution rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights and entered a plea of GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the guilty plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Complaint/Information.  Court WITHHELD entry of judgment of conviction.  Deferred Prosecution Agreement received, signed and filed.
 
Court ordered case adjourned for Review in Branch 17.  Review hearing scheduled for November 7, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Stepheny Markasia Hunter in court with attorney Fred Richardson.  Amy E Spanczak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Status Conference. Defense counsel advises that they have received discovery materials and an offer from the state. Defense further requests a Deferred Prosecution Agreement Hearing, as he will be scheduling a TAD evaluation by end of buisness today. No objections from the State. Court adjourns matter to Br 16.  Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for August 26, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Stepheny Markasia Hunter in court, via zoom, with attorney Fred Richardson.  Amy E Spanczak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Scheduling Conference. Discussion with parties regarding discovery issues. Court sets next court date for a Status Conference date. Case adjourned to Br 16.  Status conference scheduled for June 28, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Stark.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Grayson, Br. 16.

Defendant Stepheny Markasia Hunter in court with Attorney Fred Richardson.  Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 16, Judge Grayson. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 16.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 1 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.

Defendant Stepheny Markasia Hunter in court with attorney Fred Richardson.  Defendant Stepheny Markasia Hunter in custody.  Michael R Staskunas appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Stepheny Markasia Hunter appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Stark, Branch 17.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 30, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
